intro: Dasymaschalon wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan daphne, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Dasymaschalon wallichii is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
